page.title: 16AMENITIES NEAR SEISDON
page.content: As will be seen from the data recorded, there are very few amenities in this block at all and it is necessary for the local people to travel out of the area for practically all their needs. There are no schools, churches, Doctors' surgeries or recreational facilities of any kind. Some of their needs can be met in one or other of the local villages; for others it is necessary to travel to Bridgnorth, Wolverhampton or the large village of Wombourne, three or four kilometres to the south-east. Claverley has the usual village amenities as do the sister villages of Trysull and Seisdon (treated as one for most purposes). Both Claverley and Trysull and Seisdon have branches of the Women's Institute and other groups such as sports teams and horticultural societies.
